meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s2
section.heading: Specified sentences
section.leadIn: The following sentences are specified for the purpose of section 3(1)(b) of the Ordinance— (17 of 2018 s. 124)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sentence of imprisonment of 6 years or more;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a sentence of imprisonment of 2 years or more but less than 6 years in respect of a conviction for—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any of the offences specified in Schedule 1;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: conspiracy to commit any of those offences;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: inciting another to commit any of those offences;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: attempting to commit any of those offences;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: aiding, abetting, counselling or procuring the commission of any of those offences;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where a sentence of imprisonment specified in paragraph (a) or (b) is ordered to be served consecutively to some other sentence of imprisonment, or some other sentence of imprisonment is ordered to be served consecutively to a sentence of imprisonment specified in paragraph (a) or (b), that other sentence of imprisonment.

subsection.content: The Board shall meet as often as is necessary, and at such times and places as the Chairman may appoint, for the purpose of considering the cases of prisoners to whom the Ordinance applies or any matter under Part 3 of the Ordinance. (E.R. 2 of 2014)

At any meeting of the Board 5 members, 2 of whom are the representatives of the Commissioner of Correctional Services and the Commissioner of Police respectively, shall be sufficient to constitute a quorum.

subsection.leadIn: The Chairman shall preside at any meeting of the Board at which he is present, and if at any meeting of the Board the Chairman is not present—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Deputy Chairman is present, he shall preside;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the members present shall elect from among themselves a member, not being the representative of the Commissioner of Correctional Services or the Commissioner of Police, to preside.

subsection.content: Any question for consideration by the Board shall be decided by a majority of the members present at a meeting, and in the case of an equality of votes the Chairman shall have a casting as well as deliberative vote.

Where the Board so directs, and the prisoner consents, a member of the Board designated by the Board may interview a prisoner whose case the Board is to consider under Part 2 of the Ordinance. (E.R. 2 of 2014)
A member of the Board who has interviewed a prisoner shall submit a report of the interview in writing to the Board.
A report on a prisoner submitted under subsection (2) shall be considered by the Board when it considers his case.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Materials to be examined by the Board
section.content: The Board shall not make an order under section 6 of the Ordinance unless it has had the opportunity of examining the materials specified in Schedule 2.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Service of documents
section.leadIn: Service of any document on a prisoner for the purpose of the Ordinance shall be duly effected if delivered to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an address at which the prisoner is required to reside pursuant to the terms of a supervision order; or where there is no such requirement,

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an address which the prisoner has notified to the Commissioner as an address for service; or where no such address has been notified,

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the last known address of the prisoner.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Forms
section.content: Supervision orders, and orders under Part 3 of the Ordinance, shall be in such form as the Commissioner may specify.

td.p: Murder (E.R. 1 of 2022)
Manslaughter (E.R. 1 of 2022)
Offence
Description*

Societies Ordinance
(Cap. 151)
section 19(1), (2)
being or claiming to be an office-bearer of an unlawful society
being or professing to be a member of triad society
section 21(1), (2)
allowing unlawful society in building
section 22(1), (2)
inciting, etc., a person to become a member of an unlawful society
section 23(1), (2)
procuring a subscription or aid for an unlawful society
contravention of an order made on a previous conviction under section 19 or 20 of the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151)
contravention of a prohibition order under section 8 of the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151)

Crimes Ordinance
(Cap. 200)
threatening injury etc. with intent
assault with intent to cause certain acts to be done or omitted
sections 47, 48
incest
causing an explosion likely to endanger life or property
acting with intent to cause an explosion, or making or keeping explosive with intent to endanger life or property
making or possession of explosive
criminal damage and arson
threats to destroy or damage property (L.N. 495 of 1996)
possessing anything with intent to destroy or damage property (L.N. 495 of 1996)
rape
non-consensual buggery
assault with intent to commit buggery
homosexual buggery with or by a man under 16 (18 of 2014 s. 11)
buggery with a girl under 21
buggery with a mentally incapacitated person (L.N. 495 of 1996; 21 of 2020 s. 64)
gross indecency by a man with another man
bestiality
administering drugs to obtain or facilitate an unlawful sexual act
indecent assault
unlawful intercourse with a girl under 13
unlawful intercourse with a girl under 16
unlawful intercourse with a female mentally incapacitated person (21 of 2020 s. 64)
causing or encouraging prostitution of, etc., a girl or boy under 16
living on the earnings of prostitution
indecent conduct towards a child under 16

For the avoidance of doubt, where an offence under a section of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200) may, by virtue of section 153P of that Ordinance, be constituted by an act committed outside Hong Kong, a reference in this item to an offence under that section includes a reference to an offence so constituted. (31 of 2003 s. 25)

administering poison, etc., so as to endanger life or inflict grievous bodily harm

* Note:
The short description of offences in this Schedule is for ease of reference only.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Materials to be Examined by the Board

subsection.content: A report and recommendation which the Commissioner of Correctional Services has made relating to the conduct in prison of the prisoner.
A report and recommendation which the Commissioner of Police has made for the Board.
Any report that was prepared for the court of trial to assist the trial judge or magistrate, as the case may be, in determining sentence.
Any recorded observations of the trial judge or magistrate, as the case may be, in passing sentence.
Any medical, psychological or psychiatric report on the prisoner that is available to the Board.
